what: Access the Our World in Data Chart API
title: Access the Our World in Data Chart API
text: Retrieve data World Data (OWID) Chart API. OWID provides public access 5,000 charts focusing global problems poverty, disease, hunger, climate change, war, existential risks, inequality. package part econdataverse family packages aimed helping economists financial professionals work sovereign-level economic data. ðŸ’¡ ETL Catalog API currently beta relies internal APIs change regular basis. API stable, planned included package.

title: Access the Our World in Data Chart API
text: can install owidapi CRAN via: can install development version owidapi GitHub :

title: Access the Our World in Data Chart API
text: Load package: Download full life expectancy dataset: Get life expectancy data Australia, Austria, Germany: Download US life expectancy data 1970 1980: Get daily COVID-19 vaccination doses per capita Germany 2020-12-28 2020-12-31: Download data directly using URL website: can get metadata list either provoding data set name URL. difference originalChartUrl value: want fetch full catalog available charts: search keywords catalog, can use following helper: also experimental functions embed OWID charts. instance, can create HTML embed chart: want render embedded OWID charts Shiny app, can use owid_output() owid_server():
code: library(owidapi) owid_get("life-expectancy") #> # A tibble: 21,565 Ã— 4 #>    entity_name entity_id  year life_expectancy_0__sex_total__age_0 #>    <chr>       <chr>     <int>                               <dbl> #>  1 Afghanistan AFG        1950                                28.2 #>  2 Afghanistan AFG        1951                                28.6 #>  3 Afghanistan AFG        1952                                29.0 #>  4 Afghanistan AFG        1953                                29.5 #>  5 Afghanistan AFG        1954                                29.7 #>  6 Afghanistan AFG        1955                                30.4 #>  7 Afghanistan AFG        1956                                30.8 #>  8 Afghanistan AFG        1957                                31.3 #>  9 Afghanistan AFG        1958                                31.8 #> 10 Afghanistan AFG        1959                                32.3 #> # â„¹ 21,555 more rows owid_get("life-expectancy", entities = c("AUS", "AUT", "GER")) #> # A tibble: 190 Ã— 4 #>    entity_name entity_id  year life_expectancy_0__sex_total__age_0 #>    <chr>       <chr>     <int>                               <dbl> #>  1 Australia   AUS        1885                                49.0 #>  2 Australia   AUS        1895                                53.0 #>  3 Australia   AUS        1905                                57   #>  4 Australia   AUS        1921                                61.0 #>  5 Australia   AUS        1922                                62.8 #>  6 Australia   AUS        1923                                61.7 #>  7 Australia   AUS        1924                                62.5 #>  8 Australia   AUS        1925                                63.2 #>  9 Australia   AUS        1926                                62.9 #> 10 Australia   AUS        1927                                62.8 #> # â„¹ 180 more rows owid_get("life-expectancy", entities = "USA", start_date = 1970, end_date = 1980) #> # A tibble: 11 Ã— 4 #>    entity_name   entity_id  year life_expectancy_0__sex_total__age_0 #>    <chr>         <chr>     <int>                               <dbl> #>  1 United States USA        1970                                70.7 #>  2 United States USA        1971                                71.1 #>  3 United States USA        1972                                71.2 #>  4 United States USA        1973                                71.4 #>  5 United States USA        1974                                72.0 #>  6 United States USA        1975                                72.5 #>  7 United States USA        1976                                72.8 #>  8 United States USA        1977                                73.2 #>  9 United States USA        1978                                73.4 #> 10 United States USA        1979                                73.8 #> 11 United States USA        1980                                73.7 owid_get(   "daily-covid-vaccination-doses-per-capita",   entities = "DEU",   start_date = "2020-12-28",   end_date = "2020-12-31" ) #> # A tibble: 4 Ã— 4 #>   entity_name entity_id day        daily_vaccinations_smoothed_per_million #>   <chr>       <chr>     <date>                                       <dbl> #> 1 Germany     DEU       2020-12-28                                  0.0215 #> 2 Germany     DEU       2020-12-29                                  0.0406 #> 3 Germany     DEU       2020-12-30                                  0.0525 #> 4 Germany     DEU       2020-12-31                                  0.0543 url <- paste0(   "https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/civil-liberties-score-fh",   "?tab=chart&time=earliest..2023&country=ARG~AUS~BWA~CHN~ALB~DEU" ) owid_get(url = url) #> # A tibble: 126 Ã— 4 #>    entity_name entity_id  year civil.liberties.score #>    <chr>       <chr>     <int>                 <int> #>  1 Albania     ALB        2003                    42 #>  2 Albania     ALB        2004                    40 #>  3 Albania     ALB        2005                    38 #>  4 Albania     ALB        2006                    38 #>  5 Albania     ALB        2007                    39 #>  6 Albania     ALB        2008                    40 #>  7 Albania     ALB        2009                    39 #>  8 Albania     ALB        2010                    40 #>  9 Albania     ALB        2011                    39 #> 10 Albania     ALB        2012                    39 #> # â„¹ 116 more rows metadata <- owid_get_metadata("civil-liberties-score-fh") metadata_url <- owid_get_metadata(url = url) str(metadata) #> List of 3 #>  $ chart         :List of 5 #>   ..$ title           : chr "Civil liberties score" #>   ..$ subtitle        : chr "Based on the estimates and scoring by [Freedom House (2024)](#dod:freedom-house). It captures the extent of fre"| __truncated__ #>   ..$ citation        : chr "Freedom House (2025)" #>   ..$ originalChartUrl: chr "https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/civil-liberties-score-fh" #>   ..$ selection       :List of 4 #>   .. ..$ : chr "Argentina" #>   .. ..$ : chr "Australia" #>   .. ..$ : chr "Botswana" #>   .. ..$ : chr "China" #>  $ columns       :List of 1 #>   ..$ Civil liberties score:List of 13 #>   .. ..$ titleShort      : chr "Civil liberties score" #>   .. ..$ titleLong       : chr "Civil liberties score" #>   .. ..$ descriptionShort: chr "The variable identifies the fine-grained extent of freedom of expression and association, the rule of law, and "| __truncated__ #>   .. ..$ unit            : chr "" #>   .. ..$ timespan        : chr "2003-2024" #>   .. ..$ type            : chr "Integer" #>   .. ..$ owidVariableId  : int 1039982 #>   .. ..$ shortName       : chr "civlibs_score" #>   .. ..$ lastUpdated     : chr "2025-06-02" #>   .. ..$ nextUpdate      : chr "2026-06-02" #>   .. ..$ citationShort   : chr "Freedom House (2025) â€“ processed by Our World in Data" #>   .. ..$ citationLong    : chr "Freedom House (2025) â€“ processed by Our World in Data. â€œCivil liberties scoreâ€ [dataset]. Freedom House, â€œFreed"| __truncated__ #>   .. ..$ fullMetadata    : chr "https://api.ourworldindata.org/v1/indicators/1039982.metadata.json" #>  $ dateDownloaded: chr "2025-06-23" all.equal(metadata, metadata_url) #> [1] "Length mismatch: comparison on first 3 components"                      #> [2] "Component \"chart\": Component \"originalChartUrl\": 1 string mismatch" catalog <- owid_get_catalog() catalog #> # A tibble: 5,301 Ã— 19 #>    rowid    id config_id            is_inheritance_enabled created_at updated_at #>    <int> <int> <chr>                <lgl>                  <date>     <date>     #>  1    26  8727 01978d86-beee-7595-â€¦ TRUE                   2025-06-20 2025-06-21 #>  2    25  8726 01978cf4-6363-7356-â€¦ FALSE                  2025-06-20 2025-06-21 #>  3    24  8725 01978ce6-0056-70d1-â€¦ TRUE                   2025-06-20 2025-06-21 #>  4    23  8724 01978c7e-4996-7d83-â€¦ TRUE                   2025-06-20 2025-06-21 #>  5    22  8723 01978878-d5b8-78c0-â€¦ FALSE                  2025-06-19 2025-06-19 #>  6    21  8722 01978873-eaf5-75c0-â€¦ FALSE                  2025-06-19 2025-06-19 #>  7    20  8721 019787a1-5f3e-7001-â€¦ FALSE                  2025-06-19 NA         #>  8    19  8720 019782bc-b4ad-71d2-â€¦ TRUE                   2025-06-18 NA         #>  9    18  8719 019781f9-87c8-7f47-â€¦ FALSE                  2025-06-18 2025-06-18 #> 10    17  8718 019781ec-db06-7b85-â€¦ TRUE                   2025-06-18 2025-06-18 #> # â„¹ 5,291 more rows #> # â„¹ 13 more variables: last_edited_at <date>, published_at <date>, #> #   last_edited_by_user_id <int>, published_by_user_id <int>, #> #   is_indexable <lgl>, config <chr>, slug <chr>, type <chr>, title <chr>, #> #   subtitle <chr>, note <chr>, title_plus_variant <chr>, is_published <lgl> owid_search(catalog, c("climate", "carbon")) #> # A tibble: 206 Ã— 19 #>    rowid    id config_id            is_inheritance_enabled created_at updated_at #>    <int> <int> <chr>                <lgl>                  <date>     <date>     #>  1  5166  8555 0195a9ea-1bb2-7af4-â€¦ FALSE                  2025-03-18 2025-03-18 #>  2  5131  8509 01950523-a967-7c01-â€¦ TRUE                   2025-02-14 2025-03-23 #>  3  5130  8508 01950523-a857-72c1-â€¦ TRUE                   2025-02-14 2025-03-23 #>  4  5105  8472 0194b2a8-e036-7c09-â€¦ FALSE                  2025-01-29 2025-04-07 #>  5  4900  8266 01933e25-e0bc-70e5-â€¦ FALSE                  2024-11-18 2024-11-22 #>  6  4869  8222 0192d85f-7e6f-7cbb-â€¦ FALSE                  2024-10-29 2025-04-07 #>  7  5059  8032 0191c217-8b0d-7612-â€¦ TRUE                   2024-09-05 2025-05-26 #>  8  5058  8031 0191c217-8a17-7cd8-â€¦ TRUE                   2024-09-05 2025-05-26 #>  9  5057  8030 0191c217-8916-71c6-â€¦ TRUE                   2024-09-05 2025-05-26 #> 10  5056  8029 0191c217-8831-7fc9-â€¦ TRUE                   2024-09-05 2025-05-26 #> # â„¹ 196 more rows #> # â„¹ 13 more variables: last_edited_at <date>, published_at <date>, #> #   last_edited_by_user_id <int>, published_by_user_id <int>, #> #   is_indexable <lgl>, config <chr>, slug <chr>, type <chr>, title <chr>, #> #   subtitle <chr>, note <chr>, title_plus_variant <chr>, is_published <lgl> owid_embed(url) #> [1] "<iframe src=\"https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/civil-liberties-score-fh?tab=chart&time=earliest..2023&country=ARG~AUS~BWA~CHN~ALB~DEU\" loading=\"lazy\" style=\"width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;\" allow=\"web-share; clipboard-write\"></iframe>" library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(  owid_output("co2_chart") )  server <- function(input, output) {  owid_server(    "co2_chart",     "https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/co2-emissions-per-capita"   ) }  shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server)

title: Access the Our World in Data Chart API
text: owidR package broken since World Data updated API, received commit since November 2023, uses different set dependencies (e.g., data.table, httr, rvest).

what: Embed Our World in Data Chart in HTML â€” owid_embed
title: Embed Our World in Data Chart in HTML â€” owid_embed
text: Creates HTML code embed interactive chart World Data HTML document using iframe.

title: Embed Our World in Data Chart in HTML â€” owid_embed
Embed Our World in Data Chart in HTML â€” owid_embed
text: url character string containing URL World Data chart. Must begin "https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/". width character string specifying width iframe. Default "100%". height character string specifying height iframe. Default "600px".

title: Embed Our World in Data Chart in HTML â€” owid_embed
text: character string containing HTML iframe embed chart.

title: Embed Our World in Data Chart in HTML â€” owid_embed
code: owid_embed(   "https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/co2-emissions-per-capita",   width = "90%",   height = "500px" ) #> [1] "<iframe src=\"https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/co2-emissions-per-capita\" loading=\"lazy\" style=\"width: 90%; height: 500px; border: 0px none;\" allow=\"web-share; clipboard-write\"></iframe>"

what: Download data from Our World in Data â€” owid_get
title: Download data from Our World in Data â€” owid_get
text: Retrieves data World Data (OWID) specifying chart identifier direct URL. Allows filtering entities time periods.

title: Download data from Our World in Data â€” owid_get
code: owid_get(   chart_id = NULL,   entities = NULL,   start_date = NULL,   end_date = NULL,   url = NULL,   use_column_short_names = TRUE,   snake_case = TRUE )

title: Download data from Our World in Data â€” owid_get
text: chart_id Character string specifying chart identifier (e.g., "life-expectancy"). required url provided. entities Vector entity codes (e.g., c("USA", "DEU")). NULL, data available entities returned. start_date Start date filtering data. Can date string year. NULL, starts earliest available data. end_date End date filtering data. Can date string year. NULL, ends latest available data. url Direct URL OWID dataset. provided, chart_id ignored. use_column_short_names Logical. TRUE (default), uses short column names. snake_case Logical. TRUE (default), converts column names lowercase.

title: Download data from Our World in Data â€” owid_get
text: tibble containing requested OWID data.

title: Download data from Our World in Data â€” owid_get
code: # \donttest{ # Download a full table owid_get("life-expectancy") #> # A tibble: 21,565 Ã— 4 #>    entity_name entity_id  year life_expectancy_0__sex_total__age_0 #>    <chr>       <chr>     <int>                               <dbl> #>  1 Afghanistan AFG        1950                                28.2 #>  2 Afghanistan AFG        1951                                28.6 #>  3 Afghanistan AFG        1952                                29.0 #>  4 Afghanistan AFG        1953                                29.5 #>  5 Afghanistan AFG        1954                                29.7 #>  6 Afghanistan AFG        1955                                30.4 #>  7 Afghanistan AFG        1956                                30.8 #>  8 Afghanistan AFG        1957                                31.3 #>  9 Afghanistan AFG        1958                                31.8 #> 10 Afghanistan AFG        1959                                32.3 #> # â„¹ 21,555 more rows  # Download a table only for selected entities owid_get("life-expectancy", c("AUS", "AUT", "GER")) #> # A tibble: 190 Ã— 4 #>    entity_name entity_id  year life_expectancy_0__sex_total__age_0 #>    <chr>       <chr>     <int>                               <dbl> #>  1 Australia   AUS        1885                                49.0 #>  2 Australia   AUS        1895                                53.0 #>  3 Australia   AUS        1905                                57   #>  4 Australia   AUS        1921                                61.0 #>  5 Australia   AUS        1922                                62.8 #>  6 Australia   AUS        1923                                61.7 #>  7 Australia   AUS        1924                                62.5 #>  8 Australia   AUS        1925                                63.2 #>  9 Australia   AUS        1926                                62.9 #> 10 Australia   AUS        1927                                62.8 #> # â„¹ 180 more rows  # Download a table only for selected time periods owid_get("life-expectancy", c("USA"), 1970, 1980) #> # A tibble: 11 Ã— 4 #>    entity_name   entity_id  year life_expectancy_0__sex_total__age_0 #>    <chr>         <chr>     <int>                               <dbl> #>  1 United States USA        1970                                70.7 #>  2 United States USA        1971                                71.1 #>  3 United States USA        1972                                71.2 #>  4 United States USA        1973                                71.4 #>  5 United States USA        1974                                72.0 #>  6 United States USA        1975                                72.5 #>  7 United States USA        1976                                72.8 #>  8 United States USA        1977                                73.2 #>  9 United States USA        1978                                73.4 #> 10 United States USA        1979                                73.8 #> 11 United States USA        1980                                73.7  # Download daily data for selected time periods owid_get(  "daily-covid-vaccination-doses-per-capita", "DEU",  "2020-12-28", "2020-12-31" ) #> # A tibble: 4 Ã— 4 #>   entity_name entity_id day        daily_vaccinations_smoothed_per_million #>   <chr>       <chr>     <date>                                       <dbl> #> 1 Germany     DEU       2020-12-28                                  0.0215 #> 2 Germany     DEU       2020-12-29                                  0.0406 #> 3 Germany     DEU       2020-12-30                                  0.0525 #> 4 Germany     DEU       2020-12-31                                  0.0543  # Download a table by just providing an URL (with or without .csv) owid_get(  url = paste0(    "https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/civil-liberties-score-fh",    "?tab=chart&time=earliest..2023&country=ARG~AUS~BWA~CHN~ALB~DEU"  ) ) #> # A tibble: 126 Ã— 4 #>    entity_name entity_id  year civil.liberties.score #>    <chr>       <chr>     <int>                 <int> #>  1 Albania     ALB        2003                    42 #>  2 Albania     ALB        2004                    40 #>  3 Albania     ALB        2005                    38 #>  4 Albania     ALB        2006                    38 #>  5 Albania     ALB        2007                    39 #>  6 Albania     ALB        2008                    40 #>  7 Albania     ALB        2009                    39 #>  8 Albania     ALB        2010                    40 #>  9 Albania     ALB        2011                    39 #> 10 Albania     ALB        2012                    39 #> # â„¹ 116 more rows owid_get(  url = paste0(    "https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/civil-liberties-score-fh.csv",    "?tab=chart&time=earliest..2023"  ) ) #> # A tibble: 4,595 Ã— 4 #>    entity_name entity_id  year civil.liberties.score #>    <chr>       <chr>     <int>                 <int> #>  1 Abkhazia    OWID_ABK   2003                    21 #>  2 Abkhazia    OWID_ABK   2004                    21 #>  3 Abkhazia    OWID_ABK   2005                    21 #>  4 Abkhazia    OWID_ABK   2006                    21 #>  5 Abkhazia    OWID_ABK   2007                    21 #>  6 Abkhazia    OWID_ABK   2008                    21 #>  7 Abkhazia    OWID_ABK   2009                    21 #>  8 Abkhazia    OWID_ABK   2010                    22 #>  9 Abkhazia    OWID_ABK   2011                    22 #> 10 Abkhazia    OWID_ABK   2012                    22 #> # â„¹ 4,585 more rows # }

what: Download data catalog of Our World in Data â€” owid_get_catalog
title: Download data catalog of Our World in Data â€” owid_get_catalog
text: Downloads data catalog World Data (OWID) hosted Datasette.

title: Download data catalog of Our World in Data â€” owid_get_catalog
Download data catalog of Our World in Data â€” owid_get_catalog
text: snake_case Logical. TRUE (default), converts column names lowercase.

text: tibble containing OWID catalog.

what: Download metadata from Our World in Data â€” owid_get_metadata
title: Download metadata from Our World in Data â€” owid_get_metadata
text: Retrieves metadata data set World Data (OWID) specifying chart identifier direct URL.

title: Download metadata from Our World in Data â€” owid_get_metadata
Download metadata from Our World in Data â€” owid_get_metadata
text: chart_id Character string specifying chart identifier (e.g., "life-expectancy"). required url provided. url Direct URL OWID chart. provided, chart_id ignored.

title: Download metadata from Our World in Data â€” owid_get_metadata
text: list containing requested OWID metadata.

title: Download metadata from Our World in Data â€” owid_get_metadata
code: # \donttest{ # Download metadata using a data set owid_get_metadata("life-expectancy") #> $chart #> $chart$title #> [1] "Life expectancy" #>  #> $chart$subtitle #> [1] "The [period life expectancy](#dod:period-life-expectancy) at birth, in a given year." #>  #> $chart$citation #> [1] "UN WPP (2024); HMD (2024); Zijdeman et al. (2015); Riley (2005)" #>  #> $chart$originalChartUrl #> [1] "https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/life-expectancy" #>  #> $chart$selection #> $chart$selection[[1]] #> [1] "World" #>  #> $chart$selection[[2]] #> [1] "Americas" #>  #> $chart$selection[[3]] #> [1] "Europe" #>  #> $chart$selection[[4]] #> [1] "Africa" #>  #> $chart$selection[[5]] #> [1] "Asia" #>  #> $chart$selection[[6]] #> [1] "Oceania" #>  #>  #>  #> $columns #> $columns$`Period life expectancy at birth - Sex: total - Age: 0` #> $columns$`Period life expectancy at birth - Sex: total - Age: 0`$titleShort #> [1] "Life expectancy at birth" #>  #> $columns$`Period life expectancy at birth - Sex: total - Age: 0`$titleLong #> [1] "Life expectancy at birth - Various sources â€“ period tables" #>  #> $columns$`Period life expectancy at birth - Sex: total - Age: 0`$descriptionShort #> [1] "The period life expectancy at birth, in a given year." #>  #> $columns$`Period life expectancy at birth - Sex: total - Age: 0`$descriptionKey #> $columns$`Period life expectancy at birth - Sex: total - Age: 0`$descriptionKey[[1]] #> [1] "Period life expectancy is a metric that summarizes death rates across all age groups in one particular year." #>  #> $columns$`Period life expectancy at birth - Sex: total - Age: 0`$descriptionKey[[2]] #> [1] "For a given year, it represents the remaining average lifespan for a hypothetical group of people, if they experienced the same age-specific death rates throughout the rest of their lives as the age-specific death rates seen in that particular year." #>  #> $columns$`Period life expectancy at birth - Sex: total - Age: 0`$descriptionKey[[3]] #> [1] "Prior to 1950, we use HMD (2024) data combined with Zijdeman (2015). From 1950 onwards, we use UN WPP (2024) data. For old regional data, we use Riley (2005) estimates." #>  #>  #> $columns$`Period life expectancy at birth - Sex: total - Age: 0`$shortUnit #> [1] "years" #>  #> $columns$`Period life expectancy at birth - Sex: total - Age: 0`$unit #> [1] "years" #>  #> $columns$`Period life expectancy at birth - Sex: total - Age: 0`$timespan #> [1] "1543-2023" #>  #> $columns$`Period life expectancy at birth - Sex: total - Age: 0`$type #> [1] "Numeric" #>  #> $columns$`Period life expectancy at birth - Sex: total - Age: 0`$owidVariableId #> [1] 1002268 #>  #> $columns$`Period life expectancy at birth - Sex: total - Age: 0`$shortName #> [1] "life_expectancy_0__sex_total__age_0" #>  #> $columns$`Period life expectancy at birth - Sex: total - Age: 0`$lastUpdated #> [1] "2024-12-03" #>  #> $columns$`Period life expectancy at birth - Sex: total - Age: 0`$nextUpdate #> [1] "2025-12-03" #>  #> $columns$`Period life expectancy at birth - Sex: total - Age: 0`$citationShort #> [1] "UN WPP (2024); HMD (2024); Zijdeman et al. (2015); Riley (2005) â€“ with minor processing by Our World in Data" #>  #> $columns$`Period life expectancy at birth - Sex: total - Age: 0`$citationLong #> [1] "UN WPP (2024); HMD (2024); Zijdeman et al. (2015); Riley (2005) â€“ with minor processing by Our World in Data. â€œLife expectancy at birth â€“ Various sources â€“ period tablesâ€ [dataset]. Human Mortality Database, â€œHuman Mortality Databaseâ€; United Nations, â€œWorld Population Prospectsâ€; Zijdeman et al., â€œLife Expectancy at birth 2â€; James C. Riley, â€œEstimates of Regional and Global Life Expectancy, 1800-2001â€ [original data]." #>  #> $columns$`Period life expectancy at birth - Sex: total - Age: 0`$fullMetadata #> [1] "https://api.ourworldindata.org/v1/indicators/1002268.metadata.json" #>  #>  #>  #> $dateDownloaded #> [1] "2025-06-23" #>   # Download metadata using an url owid_get_metadata(  url = "https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/civil-liberties-score-fh" ) #> $chart #> $chart$title #> [1] "Civil liberties score" #>  #> $chart$subtitle #> [1] "Based on the estimates and scoring by [Freedom House (2024)](#dod:freedom-house). It captures the extent of freedom of expression and association, the rule of law, and personal autonomy. Higher scores indicate more liberties." #>  #> $chart$citation #> [1] "Freedom House (2025)" #>  #> $chart$originalChartUrl #> [1] "https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/civil-liberties-score-fh" #>  #> $chart$selection #> $chart$selection[[1]] #> [1] "Argentina" #>  #> $chart$selection[[2]] #> [1] "Australia" #>  #> $chart$selection[[3]] #> [1] "Botswana" #>  #> $chart$selection[[4]] #> [1] "China" #>  #>  #>  #> $columns #> $columns$`Civil liberties score` #> $columns$`Civil liberties score`$titleShort #> [1] "Civil liberties score" #>  #> $columns$`Civil liberties score`$titleLong #> [1] "Civil liberties score" #>  #> $columns$`Civil liberties score`$descriptionShort #> [1] "The variable identifies the fine-grained extent of freedom of expression and association, the rule of law, and personal autonomy. Higher scores indicate more liberties." #>  #> $columns$`Civil liberties score`$unit #> [1] "" #>  #> $columns$`Civil liberties score`$timespan #> [1] "2003-2024" #>  #> $columns$`Civil liberties score`$type #> [1] "Integer" #>  #> $columns$`Civil liberties score`$owidVariableId #> [1] 1039982 #>  #> $columns$`Civil liberties score`$shortName #> [1] "civlibs_score" #>  #> $columns$`Civil liberties score`$lastUpdated #> [1] "2025-06-02" #>  #> $columns$`Civil liberties score`$nextUpdate #> [1] "2026-06-02" #>  #> $columns$`Civil liberties score`$citationShort #> [1] "Freedom House (2025) â€“ processed by Our World in Data" #>  #> $columns$`Civil liberties score`$citationLong #> [1] "Freedom House (2025) â€“ processed by Our World in Data. â€œCivil liberties scoreâ€ [dataset]. what: Create OWID chart output elements in Shiny â€” owid_output
title: Create OWID chart output elements in Shiny â€” owid_output
text: function creates HTML output element embedding World Data (OWID) charts Shiny application. used UI definition Shiny app.

title: Create OWID chart output elements in Shiny â€” owid_output
Create OWID chart output elements in Shiny â€” owid_output
text: id Character string. ID output element. url Character string. URL OWID chart embed. width Character string. width chart (default: "100%"). height Character string. height chart (default: "600px").

title: Create OWID chart output elements in Shiny â€” owid_output
text: Shiny HTML output element OWID chart rendered.

title: Create OWID chart output elements in Shiny â€” owid_output
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() & curl::has_internet() library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(  owid_output("gdp_chart"),  owid_output("co2_chart") )  server <- function(input, output) {  owid_server(    "gdp_chart",    "https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/gdp-per-capita-worldbank?tab=line"  )  owid_server(    "co2_chart",    "https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/co2-emissions-per-capita",    height = "500px"  ) }  shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server) }

what: Search for keywords in OWID catalog data â€” owid_search
title: Search for keywords in OWID catalog data â€” owid_search
text: function searches vector keywords within specified columns OWID catalog data frame. columns specified, searches character factor columns.

title: Search for keywords in OWID catalog data â€” owid_search
Search for keywords in OWID catalog data â€” owid_search
text: data data frame, typically obtained owid_get_catalog. keywords character vector one keywords search . search case-insensitive. columns optional character vector column names search within. NULL (default), character factor columns searched.

title: Search for keywords in OWID catalog data â€” owid_search
text: filtered data frame containing rows match least one keywords least one specified columns.

title: Search for keywords in OWID catalog data â€” owid_search

what: owidapi: Access the Our World in Data Chart API â€” owidapi-package
title: owidapi: Access the Our World in Data Chart API â€” owidapi-package
text: Retrieve data World Data (OWID) Chart API https://docs.owid.io/projects/etl/api/. OWID provides public access 5,000 charts focusing global problems poverty, disease, hunger, climate change, war, existential risks, inequality.

title: owidapi: Access the Our World in Data Chart API â€” owidapi-package
text: Maintainer: Christoph Scheuch christoph@tidy-intelligence.com (ORCID) [copyright holder]

title: owidapi 0.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2025-06-23 Encapsulated request logic internal perform_request() function. Updated variable parsing & introduced graceful error handling owid_get_catalog()

title: owidapi 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2025-02-27 Initial release owid_get(), owid_get_metadata(), owid_get_catalog(), owid_search(). Includes experimental helpers shiny apps owid_output() owid_server().
